org.theta4j

Class Theta

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.theta4j.Theta
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class Theta
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    This class provides the interface for RICOH THETA on PTP-IP.

      Theta()
      Connect to THETA.

        public Theta()
      throws java.io.IOException
        Connect to THETA.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while connecting THETA.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.

        public void getObject(UINT32 objectHandle,
             java.io.OutputStream dst)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the object's data and writes to the dst.
        Parameters:
        objectHandle - The ObjectHandle of the object to acquire the data.
        dst - The destination for the object's data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while receiving data.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if an argument is null.

      • initiateCapture

        public UINT32 initiateCapture()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.InterruptedException
        Captures an image synchronously.
        Returns:
        The object handle of captured image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while capturing an image.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The invoker thread is interrupted while capturing an image.

      • terminateOpenCapture

        public void terminateOpenCapture()
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Exits a continuous shooting.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while exiting capturing.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        See Also:
        initiateOpenCapture()

      • initiateOpenCapture

        public UINT32 initiateOpenCapture()
                           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the video recording or the interval shooting. After starts, it can exit by the #terminateOpenCapture(long)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs while initiating capturing.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        See Also:
        terminateOpenCapture()

      • setExposureIndex

        public void setExposureIndex(ISOSpeed isoSpeed)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the ISO sensitivity. ISO sensitivity can be changed when ShutterSpeed is AUTO. It returns to the default value when the power is turned off.
        Parameters:
        isoSpeed - An ISO speed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if isoSpeed is null.

      • setStillCaptureMode

        public void setStillCaptureMode(StillCaptureMode stillCaptureMode)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the still image shooting method. Returns to the default value when the power is turned off or when #initiateOpenCapture() ends.
        Parameters:
        stillCaptureMode - A still capture mode to set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if stillCaptureMode is null.

      • getTimelapseNumber

        public int getTimelapseNumber()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Acquires the upper limit value for interval shooting.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs getting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.

      • setTimelapseNumber

        public void setTimelapseNumber(int timelapseNumber)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the upper limit value for interval shooting. Returns to the default value when the power is turned off. This property cannot be set when the StillCaptureMode is interval shooting mode. So, this property has to be set before switching the StillCaptureMode to interval shooting mode.
        Parameters:
        timelapseNumber - The upper limit value for interval shooting. The valid range is in 0 or 2-65535. The 0 means unlimited.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if timelapseNumber is null.

      • getTimelapseInterval

        public int getTimelapseInterval()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Acquires the shooting interval in msec for interval shooting.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs getting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.

      • setTimelapseInterval

        public void setTimelapseInterval(int timelapseInterval)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the shooting interval in msec for interval shooting. Returns to the default value when the power is turned off. This property cannot be set when the StillCaptureMode is interval shooting mode. So, this property has to be set before switching the StillCaptureMode to interval shooting mode.
        Parameters:
        timelapseInterval - The shooting interval in msec for interval shooting. The valid range is in 5000-3600000.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if timelapseInterval is null.

      • setAutoPowerOffDelay

        public void setAutoPowerOffDelay(int autoPowerOffDelay)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the time in minutes to start the auto power off.
        Parameters:
        autoPowerOffDelay - The time in minutes to start the auto power off. The valid range is in 0-30. The 0 disables the auto power off.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if autoPowerOffDelay is null.

      • getSleepDelay

        public int getSleepDelay()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Acquires the time in seconds to start sleep.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs getting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.

      • setSleepDelay

        public void setSleepDelay(int sleepDelay)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the time in seconds to start sleep.
        Parameters:
        sleepDelay - The time in seconds to start sleep. The valid range is in 0-1800. Does not switch to sleep mode with 0.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if sleepDelay is null.

      • setChannelNumber

        public void setChannelNumber(ChannelNumber channelNumber)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the wireless LAN channel number. This operation effects after wireless LAN OFF/ON.
        Parameters:
        channelNumber - The wireless LAN channel number to set.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs setting the value.
        org.theta4j.ptp.PtpException - if the PTP response is not OK.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if channelNumber is null.
